alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Chattahoochee and Stewart Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near the Phenix Drag Strip to Spring Hill in Alabama, and moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Richland, Omaha, Charles, Sanford, Westville, Brooklyn, Jamestown/South Fort Moore, Renfroe, Louvale, and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
